articles.description: Putin said Yevgeny Mikrin had made an “invaluable” contribution to Russia’s space program during his life.
articles.content:
The head of Russia’s human spaceflight program who contracted the coronavirus has died at age 65, the national space agency Roscosmos announced Tuesday.
Yevgeny Mikrin, designer general of the Energia aerospace and defense corporation, died weeks after atten… [+1441 chars]

articles.author: Paul Scott Anderson
articles.title: The mysterious yellow skies of WASP-79b - EarthSky
articles.description: Scientists studying the huge, hot exoplanet WASP-79b have found that, surprisingly, the planet has yellow skies instead of blue. But why it does is still a mystery.
articles.content:
Artist’s concept of WASP-79b, a hot Jupiter-like exoplanet 780 light-years from Earth. New research shows the planet has a yellow sky instead of blue as expected. Image via NASA/ ESA/ L. Hustak (STScI)/ Hubblesite.
Earth is beautiful, and we might sometimes … [+7536 chars]

articles.title: Laser-Propulsion of Graphene Sails in Microgravity - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Overseas exploration and trade during the Age of Discovery (15th-17th centuries) were possible by sail technology, and deep-space exploration will require the same for the coming Age of NewSpace. This time, however, the new sails shall move with light instead…
articles.content: Graphene light sail of 3mm in diameter with a mass of 0.25 mg ‘sets sail’ when pointed with a 1W laser. The prototype has a graphene micromembrane design that reduces the overall mass while keeping functional the complete area of the sail. Credit: Dr. Santiag… [+4564 chars]

articles.title: Yellowstone volcano: USGS records 134 earthquakes across park - Warning sign of eruption? - Express.co.uk
articles.description: YELLOWSTONE was rocked by 134 earthquakes last month, including a swarm of 20 tremors - but could the seismicity be a sign of Yellowstone volcano waking up?
